title: In Russia, ‘Nazi’ Is the Harshest Insult for Any Foe, and Now Ukraine
sub_head: Russian President Vladimir Putin has deployed emotive epithets against Volodymyr Zelensky and his government in an effort to justify invading
body:
Russian President Vladimir Putin says his invasion of Ukraine is justified because the country’s leaders are nationalists and neo-Nazis who must be stopped from carrying out a genocide against Russians and Russian-speaking citizens of Ukraine.
The claims, for which he has provided no evidence, are the latest in a litany of emotive epithets steeped in history that the Kremlin has deployed to justify its invasions of Ukraine in recent years.
